Class ReconnectCommand

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Commands.Command
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Commands.ReconnectCommand
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class ReconnectCommand extends Command implements Serializable
Represents a command used to facilitate reconnection of a player to a game session. This command is utilized in scenarios where a player needs to re-establish their connection to continue participating in the game. The `ReconnectCommand` class extends the base `Command` class, inheriting properties such as game ID, player ID, level, title, and token while adding specific behavior related to reconnection functionality. This class includes functionality for setting and retrieving a `ClientInterface` instance, which facilitates interaction with the client-side system. The `commandType` property uniquely identifies this command type during serialization and deserialization.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • ReconnectCommand

      public ReconnectCommand()
      Represents a command used to facilitate the reconnection of a player to a game session. This class extends the base Command class and allows players to re-establish their connection to an ongoing game by providing the necessary authentication and game details. The ReconnectCommand is part of the command framework for the game and is responsible for handling player reconnections in a structured and secure manner. The command can be utilized both with and without specific parameters and includes mechanisms for managing interactions with client systems. This default constructor initializes a basic instance of the ReconnectCommand without any pre-specified attributes.

    • ReconnectCommand

      public ReconnectCommand(String token, String gameId, String playerId, int lv, String title)
      Constructs a new ReconnectCommand with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      token - the token used for authentication or validation during reconnection
      gameId - the unique identifier of the game to reconnect to
      playerId - the unique identifier of the player attempting to reconnect
      lv - the level associated with the player's session or progress
      title - the title or name representing the player's current game state

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public void execute()
      Executes the logic associated with this command. This method is intended to perform the specific behavior defined for the concrete implementation of the command. The `execute` method in this context may be a placeholder or a convenience method for invoking command-specific functionality that does not operate on a specific `Player` instance. Note: For commands that require interaction with the `Player` object, an overloaded `execute` method should be used.

    • execute

      public void execute(Player player) throws IOException
      Executes the reconnection command for the specified player, facilitating the re-establishment of the player's connection to the game session.
      Specified by:
      execute in class Command
      Parameters:
      player - the player attempting to reconnect to the game session
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the reconnection process

    • getClient

      public ClientInterface getClient()
      Retrieves the client associated with this command.
      Overrides:
      getClient in class Command
      Returns:
      the client instance implementing the ClientInterface associated with this command.

    • setClient

      public void setClient(ClientInterface client)
      Sets the client instance to interact with the client-side system.
      Parameters:
      client - the ClientInterface instance to be associated with this command
